results.title: Guinea pigs is pigs
results.brief_description: Entertaining treatment of bureaucracy at its worst, based on the short story “pigs is pigs” by Ellis parker Butler. A stationmaster, who goes by the rules and insists that “guinea pigs is pigs” and therefore must travel at a higher freight rate than domestic animals, is left to content with a rapidly expanding guinea pig populations and the pater warfare of the railway administration.

results.title: Guinea gold
results.brief_description: This film presents the early history of the Bulolo goldfields in the northwestern part of what is known today as the Territory of Papua New Guinea. The gold prospectors were the explorers of this rugged country mandated to Australia by the League of Nations. The film records primitive native life of the area as it was discovered by them - a people with unique customs living in a stone-age environment. Shows the discovery of alluvial gold in the Bulolo Valley and the construction of the first dredges, every part of which was flown in three tons at a time over the mountains from Lae in three-engined Junkers aircraft. The role of the aircraft is shown to be basic in the development of the resources of the Bulolo Valley, and the valley itself with its wealth of alluvial gold was a basic part of the economic and industrial development of pre-war New Guinea.

results.title: Guilty chimneys
results.brief_description: Deals with the urgent problem of smoke-abatement. The film shows how smoking coal fires not only waste fuel, but also cause dirt and corrosion, and bring about fogs and illness. Various methods of smoke-elimination in the home and industry are outlined, in particular the wider use of gas and coke; and the establishment of new smokeless zone together with extension of existing ones is advocated.

results.title: Gueule D'amour = Lady Killer
results.brief_description:
Lucien Bourrache, colonial soldier stationed in Orange, is a lady’s man. While on a business trip to Cannes, Lucien meets Madeleine. Lucien accepts to lend money to Madeleine that she later looses at the gambling table. Although Lucien is smitten by Madeleine, she rejects him. Lucien returns to Orange and resigns from the army in order to follow Madeleine to Paris, where he discovers that she is kept by an other man. Raoul Ploquin was at the time in charge of the French section of the German production company UFA. He had Gremillon under contract to film ‘L’Etrange Monsieur Victor’ which was delayed. Ploquin organised the Gremillon-Gabin meeting and filming started soon after at the Neubabelsberg studios and in Orange and Cannes for the exteriors.

Credits: Producer, Raoul Ploquin ; director, Jean Gremillon ; writer, Charles Spaak ; photography, Gunther Rittau ; music, Lothar Bruhne ; assistant director, Louis Daquin.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Mireille Balin, Rene Lefevre, Marguerite Deval, Pierre Etchepare, Jane Marken, Jean Ayme, Robert Casa, Henri Poupon, Pierre Magnier.

results.title: Guess who's coming to dinner? (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Katharine Hepburn and Spencer Tracy portray the proud parents of a young lady who’s about to bring home the man she intends to marry. They’ve heard he’s good looking and full of career prospects but when they discover that he’s black, they find that they’re not as broadminded as they thought. Sidney Poitier is the son-in-law elect in this examination of prejudice and social manners.

results.title: Guerillas in our midst
results.brief_description: A fascinating exploration of the “art terrorist” activities of the New York Guerrilla Girls, a group of feminist artists who use street theatre and innovative graphics and design to draw attention to the under-representation of women and people of colour in New York art society. Interviews with art collectors, art-house curators and artists reveal the extent to which the tactics of the Guerrilla Girls (who wear gorilla masks to conceal their identity) have forced the established art community in New York to examine their sexist and/or racist assumptions about art. By combining wit, humour and style with politics the Guerrilla Girls are part of a radical street culture, who, along with such artists as Act-Up’s Gran Fury, are altering the graphic landscape of contemporary New York City.

results.title: Guardians of the wild
results.brief_description: Every day, fifty different species of animals disappear from this planet. However, there is hope, as a group of people around the world dedicate their lives to saving the endangered inhabitants of the planet. The animals featured include elephants, cheetahs, the rhinoceros and the wildlife of the Channel Islands.

results.title: Guanaco of Patagonia
results.creator_credit: William L. Franklin and Megan Epler
results.brief_description: A study pf the unique social system of the guanaco, a camel-like animal found in Patagonia, in which family groups aggressively defend fixed territories and expel dependent yearlings.
